title: 17-year-old killed in shooting
content:
KOKOMO – A 17-year-old was killed in a shooting Sunday afternoon in what Kokomo Police investigators believe was a drug deal gone wrong.
Kaliel Rucker, 21, Kokomo, was arrested and charged for the murder of LaMarcus McGraw, 17, Kokomo, as well as dealing marijuana and possession of marijuana. A 15-year-old was also arrested on charges of attempted robbery, dealing marijuana and possession of marijuana.
Officers responded at around 12:24 p.m. to the Village Pantry at 904 W. Jefferson St., according to KPD Maj. Brian Seldon, where they found McGraw on the ground with several gunshot wounds.
Rucker allegedly fled the scene before police arrived, but was caught by officers several blocks away, with a handgun that police say was used in the shooting. According to Seldon, Rucker admitted to shooting McGraw after he was apprehended.
An additional weapon was found at the scene, and Seldon said it was possible gunfire was exchanged between the parties, but that is still under investigation.
The 15-year-old was taken into custody on the scene, which appeared to be a prearranged meeting place with all three people involved for a drug deal.
“It is disturbing when you have these teenagers … involved in this sort of crime,” said Seldon. “It is disturbing.”
Seldon said the relationship between McGraw, Rucker and the 15-year-old is under investigation, as is the case as a whole. Anyone with additional information is asked to contact Detective Chad Rodgers at 765-456-7350, or the Kokomo Police Hotline at 765-456-7017.
